summary:
The Security Council,
Recalling previous resolutions and statements on Côte d’Ivoire and the subregion,
Reaffirming commitment to Côte d’Ivoire’s sovereignty, independence, territorial integrity, and unity,
Recalling endorsement of the International Working Group (IWG) final communiqué of 15 January 2006,
 Reaffirming IWG's mandate to assist the Prime Minister and monitor the peace process,
 Noting the Secretary-General's report of 3 January 2006 (S/2006/2),
 Expressing concern at the persistence of the crisis and obstacles to peace and national reconciliation,
 Determining the situation in Côte d’Ivoire poses a threat to international peace and security,
Acting under Chapter VII of the Charter,
1. Extends mandates of UNOCI and French forces until 15 December 2006;
2. Extends provisions of paragraph 3 of resolution 1609 (2005) for the same period;
3. Intends to review UNOCI's tasks and troop level, considering the Secretary-General's report and progress in implementing the IWG's roadmap, aiming for elections by 31 October 2006;
4. Remains actively seized of the matter.
